actions.args: {"body": {"name": "Further `store` collections performance testing and enhancements.", "summary": "The goal of this proposal is to thoroughly test the \\\\\\\"unstable\\\\\\\" collections and see if those can be stabilized. In pursuit of this goal tests for other `store` collections must be introduced, showcasing basic operations on big number of elements.\\\\nAdditionally `Lazy` is going to receive a method that allows for explicit storage removal.", "category": "Tooling & Infrastructure", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": "frol.near", "description": "# Overview\\\\nThe goal of this proposal is to thoroughly test the \\\\\\\"unstable\\\\\\\" collections and see if those can be stabilized. In pursuit of this goal tests for other `store` collections must be introduced, showcasing basic operations on big number of elements. Additionally `Lazy` is going to receive a method that allows for explicit storage removal.\\\\n\\\\n# Background\\\\n`LazyOption` and `TreeMap` collections are still under unstable feature-flag. `LazyOption` lacks integration testing to determine if it indeed upholds the assumptions in terms of storage I/O. `TreeMap` used to have really poor iteration performance, which is still the case compared to other collections. Therefore it has been decided to test how this collection behaves when holding a large number of elements. \\\\nThere has also been a request for the ability to drop `Lazy` storage for easier contract migrations.\\\\n\\\\n## Relevant reading:\\\\n### TreeMap\\\\n1. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/issues/818#issuecomment-1252681346\\\\n2. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/pull/964\\\\n3. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/issues/928\\\\n4. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/issues/1199\\\\n\\\\n### LazyOption\\\\n1. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/issues/1199\\\\n\\\\n### Lazy\\\\n1. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/issues/1218\\\\n\\\\n# Deliverables\\\\n1. Cover applicable `store` collections with tests showcasing basic operations, while holding ~100k elements.\\\\n2. Cover `LazyOption` with integration tests showcasing assumptions about it\\\\\\'s storage usage patterns. Either confirm those assumptions or fix and move out of `unstable`.\\\\n3. Implement a `remove` method for `Lazy` values and test that.\\\\n4. Either confirm that `TreeMap` is usable via action item `1` and move it out of unstable or identify further steps for performance improvement. (NB: Bearing in mind that any kind of storage representation changes will affect some of the big modules like NFT/FT.). \\\\n\\\\n# Timeline and funding\\\\nThe estimated timeline for delivery is within the next month, with a total funding requirement of 5000 USDT, paid once the PR is raised and ready for review.", "linked_proposals": [81], "receiver_account": "22516c1b4e5d40db919e5e56a040c5670eac947fcb53a71207d5ce640a973820", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "5000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDT"}, "labels": [], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 123673371}

{"data": {"devhub.near": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"We have just received a new *Tooling & Infrastructure* proposal.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**By**: @22516c1b4e5d40db919e5e56a040c5670eac947fcb53a71207d5ce640a973820\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Title**: \\\\u{201c}Further `store` collections performance testing and enhancements.\\\\u{201c}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Summary**:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThe goal of this proposal is to thoroughly test the \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"unstable\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" collections and see if those can be stabilized. In pursuit of this goal tests for other `store` collections must be introduced, showcasing basic operations on big number of elements.\\\\\\\\nAdditionally `Lazy` is going to receive a method that allows for explicit storage removal.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRead the full proposal and share your feedback on [DevHub](/devhub.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=154)\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

{"proposal": {"id": 154, "snapshot": {"name": "Further `store` collections performance testing and enhancements.", "labels": [], "summary": "The goal of this proposal is to thoroughly test the \\\\\\\"unstable\\\\\\\" collections and see if those can be stabilized. In pursuit of this goal tests for other `store` collections must be introduced, showcasing basic operations on big number of elements.\\\\nAdditionally `Lazy` is going to receive a method that allows for explicit storage removal.", "category": "Tooling & Infrastructure", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "editor_id": "22516c1b4e5d40db919e5e56a040c5670eac947fcb53a71207d5ce640a973820", "timestamp": "1721296120023354785", "supervisor": "frol.near", "description": "# Overview\\\\nThe goal of this proposal is to thoroughly test the \\\\\\\"unstable\\\\\\\" collections and see if those can be stabilized. In pursuit of this goal tests for other `store` collections must be introduced, showcasing basic operations on big number of elements. Additionally `Lazy` is going to receive a method that allows for explicit storage removal.\\\\n\\\\n# Background\\\\n`LazyOption` and `TreeMap` collections are still under unstable feature-flag. `LazyOption` lacks integration testing to determine if it indeed upholds the assumptions in terms of storage I/O. `TreeMap` used to have really poor iteration performance, which is still the case compared to other collections. Therefore it has been decided to test how this collection behaves when holding a large number of elements. \\\\nThere has also been a request for the ability to drop `Lazy` storage for easier contract migrations.\\\\n\\\\n## Relevant reading:\\\\n### TreeMap\\\\n1. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/issues/818#issuecomment-1252681346\\\\n2. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/pull/964\\\\n3. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/issues/928\\\\n4. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/issues/1199\\\\n\\\\n### LazyOption\\\\n1. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/issues/1199\\\\n\\\\n### Lazy\\\\n1. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/issues/1218\\\\n\\\\n# Deliverables\\\\n1. Cover applicable `store` collections with tests showcasing basic operations, while holding ~100k elements.\\\\n2. Cover `LazyOption` with integration tests showcasing assumptions about it\\\\\\'s storage usage patterns. Either confirm those assumptions or fix and move out of `unstable`.\\\\n3. Implement a `remove` method for `Lazy` values and test that.\\\\n4. Either confirm that `TreeMap` is usable via action item `1` and move it out of unstable or identify further steps for performance improvement. (NB: Bearing in mind that any kind of storage representation changes will affect some of the big modules like NFT/FT.). \\\\n\\\\n# Timeline and funding\\\\nThe estimated timeline for delivery is within the next month, with a total funding requirement of 5000 USDT, paid once the PR is raised and ready for review.", "linked_proposals": [81], "receiver_account": "22516c1b4e5d40db919e5e56a040c5670eac947fcb53a71207d5ce640a973820", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "5000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDT"}, "author_id": "22516c1b4e5d40db919e5e56a040c5670eac947fcb53a71207d5ce640a973820", "snapshot_history": [], "social_db_post_block_height": "0"}}

{"id": 154, "body": {"name": "Further `store` collections performance testing and enhancements.", "summary": "The goal of this proposal is to thoroughly test the \\\\\\\"unstable\\\\\\\" collections and see if those can be stabilized. In pursuit of this goal tests for other `store` collections must be introduced, showcasing basic operations on big number of elements.\\\\nAdditionally `Lazy` is going to receive a method that allows for explicit storage removal.", "category": "Tooling & Infrastructure", "timeline": {"status": "CANCELLED", "kyc_verified": false, "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "frol.near", "description": "# Overview\\\\nThe goal of this proposal is to thoroughly test the \\\\\\\"unstable\\\\\\\" collections and see if those can be stabilized. In pursuit of this goal tests for other `store` collections must be introduced, showcasing basic operations on big number of elements. Additionally `Lazy` is going to receive a method that allows for explicit storage removal.\\\\n\\\\n# Background\\\\n`LazyOption` and `TreeMap` collections are still under unstable feature-flag. `LazyOption` lacks integration testing to determine if it indeed upholds the assumptions in terms of storage I/O. `TreeMap` used to have really poor iteration performance, which is still the case compared to other collections. Therefore it has been decided to test how this collection behaves when holding a large number of elements. \\\\nThere has also been a request for the ability to drop `Lazy` storage for easier contract migrations.\\\\n\\\\n## Relevant reading:\\\\n### TreeMap\\\\n1. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/issues/818#issuecomment-1252681346\\\\n2. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/pull/964\\\\n3. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/issues/928\\\\n4. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/issues/1199\\\\n\\\\n### LazyOption\\\\n1. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/issues/1199\\\\n\\\\n### Lazy\\\\n1. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/issues/1218\\\\n\\\\n# Deliverables\\\\n1. Cover applicable `store` collections with tests showcasing basic operations, while holding ~100k elements.\\\\n2. Cover `LazyOption` with integration tests showcasing assumptions about it\\\\\\'s storage usage patterns. Either confirm those assumptions or fix and move out of `unstable`.\\\\n3. Implement a `remove` method for `Lazy` values and test that.\\\\n4. Either confirm that `TreeMap` is usable via action item `1` and move it out of unstable or identify further steps for performance improvement. (NB: Bearing in mind that any kind of storage representation changes will affect some of the big modules like NFT/FT.). \\\\n\\\\n# Timeline and funding\\\\nThe estimated timeline for delivery is within the next month, with a total funding requirement of 5000 USDT, paid once the PR is raised and ready for review.", "linked_proposals": [81], "receiver_account": "22516c1b4e5d40db919e5e56a040c5670eac947fcb53a71207d5ce640a973820", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "5000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDT"}, "labels": []}

{"id": 154, "body": {"name": "Further `store` collections performance testing and enhancements.", "summary": "The goal of this proposal is to thoroughly test the \\\\\\\"unstable\\\\\\\" collections and see if those can be stabilized. In pursuit of this goal tests for other `store` collections must be introduced, showcasing basic operations on big number of elements.\\\\nAdditionally `Lazy` is going to receive a method that allows for explicit storage removal.", "category": "Tooling & Infrastructure", "timeline": {"status": "CANCELLED", "kyc_verified": false, "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "frol.near", "description": "# Overview\\\\nThe goal of this proposal is to thoroughly test the \\\\\\\"unstable\\\\\\\" collections and see if those can be stabilized. In pursuit of this goal tests for other `store` collections must be introduced, showcasing basic operations on big number of elements. Additionally `Lazy` is going to receive a method that allows for explicit storage removal.\\\\n\\\\n# Background\\\\n`LazyOption` and `TreeMap` collections are still under unstable feature-flag. `LazyOption` lacks integration testing to determine if it indeed upholds the assumptions in terms of storage I/O. `TreeMap` used to have really poor iteration performance, which is still the case compared to other collections. Therefore it has been decided to test how this collection behaves when holding a large number of elements. \\\\nThere has also been a request for the ability to drop `Lazy` storage for easier contract migrations.\\\\n\\\\n## Relevant reading:\\\\n### TreeMap\\\\n1. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/issues/818#issuecomment-1252681346\\\\n2. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/pull/964\\\\n3. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/issues/928\\\\n4. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/issues/1199\\\\n\\\\n### LazyOption\\\\n1. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/issues/1199\\\\n\\\\n### Lazy\\\\n1. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/issues/1218\\\\n\\\\n# Deliverables\\\\n1. Cover applicable `store` collections with tests showcasing basic operations, while holding ~100k elements.\\\\n2. Cover `LazyOption` with integration tests showcasing assumptions about it\\\\\\'s storage usage patterns. Either confirm those assumptions or fix and move out of `unstable`.\\\\n3. Implement a `remove` method for `Lazy` values and test that.\\\\n4. Either confirm that `TreeMap` is usable via action item `1` and move it out of unstable or identify further steps for performance improvement. (NB: Bearing in mind that any kind of storage representation changes will affect some of the big modules like NFT/FT.). \\\\n\\\\n# Timeline and funding\\\\nThe estimated timeline for delivery is within the next month, with a total funding requirement of 5000 USDT, paid once the PR is raised and ready for review.", "linked_proposals": [81], "receiver_account": "22516c1b4e5d40db919e5e56a040c5670eac947fcb53a71207d5ce640a973820", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "5000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDT"}, "labels": []}
{"id": 153, "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "kyc_verified": false, "timeline_version": "V1", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}}

useState(null);\\\\nconst [description, setDescription] = useState(null);\\\\nconst [summary, setSummary] = useState(null);\\\\nconst [consent, setConsent] = useState({ toc: false, coc: false data.snapshot_history.find((item) => item.timestamp === timestamp) ??\\\\n data.snapshot;\\\\n }\\\\n if (\\\\n draftProposalData &&\\\\n editProposalData &&\\\\n editProposalData.id === setRequestedSponsor(snapshot.requested_sponsor);\\\\n setRequestedSponsorshipAmount(snapshot.requested_sponsorship_usd_amount);\\\\n setSupervisor(snapshot.supervisor);\\\\n\\\\n const token = {\\\\n setAllowDraft(false);\\\\n }\\\\n}, [draftProposalData]);\\\\n\\\\nuseEffect(() => {\\\\n if (showProposalPage) {\\\\n return;\\\\n }\\\\n setDisabledSubmitBtn(\\\\n isTxnCreated ||\\\\n !title ||\\\\n !description ||\\\\n !summary ||\\\\n !category ||\\\\n !requestedSponsorshipAmount ||\\\\n !receiverAccount ||\\\\n !requestedSponsor ||\\\\n !consent.toc ||\\\\n !consent.coc\\\\n );\\\\n editProposalData?.snapshot?.linked_proposals?.length > 0\\\\n ) {\\\\n editProposalData.snapshot.linked_proposals.map((item) => {\\\\n useCache(\\\\n () =>\\\\n Near.asyncView(\\\\\\\"devhub.near\\\\\\\", \\\\\\\"get_proposal\\\\\\\", {\\\\n proposal_id: parseInt(item),\\\\n }).then((proposal) => {\\\\n setLinkedProposals([\\\\n ...linkedProposals,\\\\n {\\\\n label: \\\\\\\"# \\\\\\\" + proposal.id + \\\\\\\" : \\\\\\\" + proposal.snapshot.name,\\\\n value: proposal.id,\\\\n },\\\\n ]);\\\\n }),\\\\n item + \\\\\\\"linked_proposals\\\\\\\",\\\\n { subscribe: false }\\\\n );\\\\n });\\\\n }\\\\n}, [editProposalData]);\\\\n\\\\nconst InputContainer = ({ heading, description, children }) => {\\\\n return (\\\\n
\\\\n {heading}\\\\n {description && (\\\\n

\\\\n );\\\\n};\\\\n\\\\n// show proposal created after txn approval for popup wallet\\\\nuseEffect(() => {\\\\n if (isTxnCreated) {\\\\n if (editProposalData) {\\\\n setOldProposalData(editProposalData);\\\\n if (\\\\n editProposalData &&\\\\n typeof editProposalData === \\\\\\\"object\\\\\\\" &&\\\\n oldProposalData &&\\\\n typeof oldProposalData === \\\\\\\"object\\\\\\\" &&\\\\n JSON.stringify(editProposalData) !== JSON.stringify(oldProposalData)\\\\n ) {\\\\n setCreateTxn(false);\\\\n setProposalId(editProposalData.id);\\\\n setShowProposalPage(true);\\\\n }\\\\n } else {\\\\n const proposalIds = Near.view(\\\\n \\\\\\\"devhub.near\\\\\\\",\\\\n \\\\\\\"get_all_proposal_ids\\\\\\\"\\\\n );\\\\n if (Array.isArray(proposalIds) && !proposalIdsArray) {\\\\n setProposalIdsArray(proposalIds);\\\\n }\\\\n if (\\\\n Array.isArray(proposalIds) &&\\\\n Array.isArray(proposalIdsArray) &&\\\\n proposalIds.length !== proposalIdsArray.length\\\\n ) {\\\\n setCreateTxn(false);\\\\n setProposalId(proposalIds[proposalIds.length - 1]);\\\\n setShowProposalPage(true);\\\\n }\\\\n }\\\\n }\\\\n});\\\\n\\\\nuseEffect(() => {\\\\n if (props.transactionHashes) {\\\\n setLoading(true);\\\\n useCache(\\\\n () =>\\\\n asyncFetch(\\\\\\\"https://rpc.mainnet.near.org\\\\\\\", {\\\\n method: \\\\\\\"POST\\\\\\\",\\\\n headers: {\\\\n \\\\\\\"content-type\\\\\\\": \\\\\\\"application/json\\\\\\\",\\\\n },\\\\n body: JSON.stringify({\\\\n jsonrpc: \\\\\\\"2.0\\\\\\\",\\\\n id: \\\\\\\"dontcare\\\\\\\",\\\\n method: \\\\\\\"tx\\\\\\\",\\\\n params: [props.transactionHashes, context.accountId],\\\\n }),\\\\n }).then((transaction) => {\\\\n const transaction_method_name =\\\\n transaction?.body?.result?.transaction?.actions[0].FunctionCall\\\\n .method_name;\\\\n\\\\n const is_edit_or_add_post_transaction =\\\\n transaction_method_name == \\\\\\\"add_proposal\\\\\\\"
